titleStmt.title: O. D. McManama et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8885

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency James F Robinson Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Grant County would respectfully represent to your excellency that at the present term of the Grant circuit Court J D Hutcherson was fined $147 -- upon an indictment for stealing the horse of one Jay Kinslaer -- the Jury found him not guilty of the felony but found him guilty of a trespass to which he plead guilty -- the evidence was that he took the horse of Kinslaer at night to get out of the way of some soldiers that he feared would arrest him -- that he went to the residence of A Morris a mile from Kinslaers in the road to New Liberty where he was going --
called up Morris, told him he had Kinslaers horse & requested him to go the next day & tell his Hutchersons wife where he was gone -- She was at in sight of Kinslaers -- From there he went to the residence of one T J McGinnis in the road a mile & a half from Kinslaers called him up & told him he had Kinslaers horse & requested him to go to Kinslaers the next day & tell Kinslaer he had his horse & would send it home -- He was by one of Kinslaers band the same night & gave up the horse & the horse was returned to Kinslaer the same night -- He is a very poor man -- We think the fine extravegant
& cruel -- We therefore most respectfully ask that your Excellency remit so much of said fine as you have the constitutional power to remit -- Williamstown

O, D, Mcmanama
John G Lucas
W, T, James
R G. Marks
H Thomas Jurry
J T Daniel
Isaac Ranken Jurry
W W Cllark Jury
J Straussel
John H. Carter
J. F. Sheriff
H Hall
Ben Hamon Edens
O P Hogue
Wm G, Cornrad
Jno J. Smith
Jed Ashcroft
Squire Childey
W S Rankin
Counsel for Huterhersun --
J. O'Hara Jr
E. H. Smith
B. Stewart
W, T, Simmons
A Kindall
J, W, Collins
Wm F. Tulls
W Tully
W Strand
William Smith
William Oldham
W. H. Childers
Ira, W, Jones
Thos A Franklin
B. Wilson Jailor, G, C
J M Collins
Pettn of Citizens of Grant to remit fine of J. D. Hutchinson
This case has been detailed by Mr. Scott Comths Atty
I think the fine excessive & remit all but Fifty dollars & costs

J F Robinson
J D Hucherson
Iss June 13, 1863
